Feature Scenario: SSE test randomness of 32 bit key
Testcase steps: Call method 'GetRandom32BitKey()' in a loop, 'n' times. Save all the 'n' 32 bit key values
Expected Result: None of the 'n' generated 32 bit keys are the same, all are unique

Feature Scenario: SSE test encrypt original string, followed by decrypt, to get back original string
Testcase steps: Take any string "abcd". Now, call method 'EncryptWithAES256RandomKey' to encrypt this. With the encrypted byte[], call method 'DecryptWithAES256'
Expected Result: The original string "abcd" is got back after encrypt-decrypt sequence with no change in the value of the string

Feature Scenario: To test bucket creation with SSE option
Testcase steps: Create a bucket 'b' with the SSE option selected. After creation, check this bucket 'b' by listing the buckets, for the encryption (SSE) option
Expected Result: On listing all the buckets, the Encryption is shown as Enabled (with text and icon) for this bucket 'b'

Feature Scenario: To test object upload on encrypted bucket
Testcase steps:
In the bucket 'b', upload a .txt file or any ascii readable content
 in a file
Expected Result: Check this file, on the cloud backend. Try to view it, it should be encrypted and not readable

Feature Scenario: To test object download on encrypted bucket
Testcase steps:
In the bucket 'b', upload a .txt file or any ascii readable content
 in a file
Expected Result: Check this file, on the cloud backend. Try to download and view it, it should be encrypted and not readable. Now, download the file in OSDS, view it. It should be decrypted and readable

Feature Scenario: To test object upload on non-encrypted bucket
Testcase Title: SSE Upload object with No Encryption
Testcase steps:
On bucket 'b', modify the SSE setting to NONE. In the bucket 'b', upload a .txt file or any ascii readable content
 in a file
Expected Result: Check this file, on the cloud backend. Try to view it, it should be encrypted and  readable
Each test case ofSSE_CreateBucket_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_Enc,SSE_DownloadObj_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_NoEnc has same behavior on HWS
Each test case ofSSE_CreateBucket_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_Enc,SSE_DownloadObj_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_NoEnc has same behavior on GCP
Each test case ofSSE_CreateBucket_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_Enc,SSE_DownloadObj_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_NoEnc has same behavior on Azure
Each test case ofSSE_CreateBucket_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_Enc,SSE_DownloadObj_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_NoEnc has same behavior on CEPH
Each test case ofSSE_CreateBucket_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_Enc,SSE_DownloadObj_Enc,SSE_UploadObj_NoEnc has same behavior on AWS
